articles.title: RAM is ruining everything
articles.description: Price hikes related to the memory shortage aren’t just coming for PC gamers; smartphones, laptops, and storage drives could soon get increases, too.

articles.title: The disinformation wars are here
articles.description: An exploration of the growing influence of disinformation and censorship, particularly within right-wing circles.
articles.author: Sarah Frier

articles.title: Wake Up Dead Man digs deep for a darker, more powerful Knives Out
articles.description: A review of the Netflix movie 'Wake Up Dead Man' discussing its connection to the 'Knives Out' series.
articles.author: Vincent Berger

articles.title: I’m obsessed with Redfin’s AI search
articles.description: Redfin’s new AI-powered search chatbot is impressive and potentially a major shift in how people find homes.
articles.author: Suri Chawla

articles.title: Australia boots kids under 16 off social media: how platforms are responding
articles.description: Australia's new law banning social media use for those under 16 is prompting responses from major platforms. This article explores the legal changes and how companies are adapting.
articles.author: Sarah Edwards

articles.title: The Verge subscription turns one
articles.description: The Verge's subscription service celebrates its first anniversary, reflecting on growth and future plans.

articles.title: mandatory age checks
articles.description: Who could have seen that coming? UK regulator Ofcom’s annualOnline Nation reportshows that major porn sites took a traffic hit following the introduction ofmandatory age checks, while VPN use shot up — but has been steadily declining since, which may ease fears that aVPN banis next on the agenda.

articles.title: The AI industry’s biggest week: Google’s rise, RL mania, and a party boat
articles.description: The AI industry experienced a major week with Google's advancements, the resurgence of Reinforcement Learning, and the NeurIPS conference.

articles.title: The Switch’s Virtual Boy Accessory Is Available for Pre-Order
articles.description: You can try to get oneon Nintendo’s website, as spottedby Wario64, though it’s only available for paid Nintendo Switch Online members. Good luck snagging one.

articles.title: Call of Duty won’t release Modern Warfare or Black Ops back to back anymore
articles.description: Activision is changing the release schedule for Modern Warfare and Black Ops titles, moving them apart to allow for more focused development.

articles.title: Linux is becoming real competition
articles.description: Microsoft seems to have gotten the message thatLinux is becoming real competitionand thatthe Xbox Allyneeds more work! “[W]e will continue refining system behaviors that matter most to gaming: background workload management, power and scheduling improvements, graphics stack optimizations, and updated drivers,”the company writes.

articles.title: holding a hearing to first consider the package
articles.description: A key committee scheduled a markup of 18 bills, including the revised Kids Online Safety Act, for Thursday. That’s just over a week sinceholding a hearing to first consider the package. Afterkilling KOSA last year, the House may be trying to leave its mark before the holiday break.

articles.title: A first look at Google’s Project Aura glasses built with Xreal
articles.description: Google’s Project Aura glasses are built with Xreal and offer a new approach to augmented reality by focusing on software-based AR rather than entirely new hardware.

articles.title: The next Pebble gadget is the Index 01, a ring with a microphone
articles.description: The Pebble Index 01 is a new smart ring with a microphone, designed for notifications and hands-free control.

articles.title: Some of Ikea’s Matter-compatible smart devices are now available in the US
articles.description: Ikea has released a selection of Matter-compatible smart sensors, including motion, temperature, and humidity sensors, in the US.
articles.author: Drew Sterne

articles.title: Both sides of the aisle hate the AI moratorium
articles.description: It’s the one of the few things Republicans and Democrats can agree on right now.

articles.title: recently retired from Apple
articles.description: Jeff Williams, whorecently retired from Apple, will stand for election “as a new independent director at the company’s 2026 annual meeting of shareholders,”Disney says.The boardwill be expanded to 11 members.

articles.title: Somehow, this AI-generated McDonald’s ad about hating Christmas was a flop
articles.description: McDonald's tried to make an AI-generated Christmas ad, and it completely bombed. Here's what happened.

articles.title: Google is powering a new US military AI platform
articles.description: Google is working with the US military to develop a new AI platform based on Gemini, potentially marking a significant shift in the company's AI strategy.
articles.author: Eric Appelbaum

articles.title: Will the SpaceX S-1 Finally Drive Me Around the Bend
articles.description: SpaceX is planning to go public at a valuation that would make it the biggest listing of all time, Bloomberg reports. “The Elon Musk-led company is targeting a valuation of about $1.5 trillion for the entire company” and while they’re saying they plan for next year, it’s a Musk company so you know what that means: “the timing could slip until 2027.” SpaceX expects $15 billion in 2025 revenue, and $22 billion to $24 billion in 2026, mostly due to Starlink.

articles.title: CoreWeave CEO defends AI circular deals as ‘working together’
articles.description: CoreWeave CEO defends AI circular deals as ‘working together’
articles.author: lucas.ropek

articles.title: Unconventional AI confirms its massive $475M seed round
articles.description: Unconventional AI, a company focused on creating a more accessible and intuitive AI platform, has raised a massive $475M in seed funding.
articles.author: Marina Temkin

articles.title: Hinge CEO steps down to launch Overtone, an AI dating app
articles.description: Hinge CEO Justin McLeod is launching a new AI-powered dating app called Overtone, pivoting away from his previous focus on traditional dating.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: Fal nabs $140M in fresh funding led by Sequoia, tripling valuation to $4.5B
articles.description: Fal, a startup focusing on AI-powered personalized learning, has raised $140 million in a new funding round led by Sequoia Capital, dramatically increasing its valuation to $4.5 billion.

articles.title: Cashew Research is going after the $90B market research industry with AI
articles.description: Cashew Research is targeting the $90B market research industry with its AI-powered platform, offering a new approach to data analysis.
